DOC.brief_summary: This is a randomized clinical research, with triple blinded multicenter involving the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, through the School of Nursing Anna Nery, as a proponent and research coordinator; and as a collaborative educational institutions, the Federal University of Espirito Santo, represented by the Department of Nursing; and the Higher School of Sciences of the Santa Casa de Misericordia de Vitoria, through the Master's Programme in Public Policy and Local Development. As Research, the study covers health units of the Municipal Family Health Maric√° / Rio de Janeiro, the Municipal Victoria Health / Holy Spirit, beyond the scope of Integrated Project Research-Service (PIPA), linked to Nursing Anna Nery / Federal University of Rio de Janeiro. The object of investigation is the effectiveness of acupuncture in nursing care in complementary treatment of adult patients Diabetes Mellitus type II.
DOC.brief_title: Acupuncture in the Complementary Treatment of Diabetes Mellitus Type II
DOC.detailed_description: This study has the general objective to evaluate the effectiveness of acupuncture as a complementary treatment to medication used in patients with diabetes mellitus type II, based on the nursing diagnoses.
DOC.criteria: Be in possession of Diabetes Mellitus Type II only It is undergoing treatment for at least 1 year properly prescribed (to be confirmed with the medication of revenue) Report difficulties in glycemic control, regular saving measures higher than recommended by the Brazilian Society of Diabetes (postprandial up to 180mg / dl) Have a lower limb amputated or part of them (because of the location of the selected acupoints for the treatment protocol) Be insulin Being a smoker Be alcoholic Be in drug treatment for other diseases including obesity Be making specific diet for weight loss Practicing regular physical activity Be in possession of cancer Being pregnant
